WorkItem.ClosedComment: Thanks for reporting this, we are aware of the performance differences between Win7 and Win8. We have a fixed this for the next release where any machine with IE 10 installed should have the same performance characteristics.
WorkItem.Description:
After upgrading to 0.9.1 (on win8 machine) I still have bad performance in editing
CPU spikes around 40-50% on a 4 core machine.
Code completion often lags...
I have around 161KB of code (30 files)

Maybe you should consider a native implementation of the language service (maybe generated from the javascript language service)

See my new comment please ...

Comments.Message:
Since upgrade to 0.9.1.1 the situation has changed:
One a Windows8 machine, performance is quite good
But I also have a Windows7 machine, on which the editing performance is still horrible.
Do you have good performance on a windows7 machine?
I read performance on windows8 machine is good because the new javascript engine is used there.
The project unfortunately is to complex (part of a big MVC application) to upload it and I also am not allowed to upload our application code...

There's not really enough information here for us to do anything. We edit similar-sized solutions without much problem, but have found that some code constructs present much more performance problems than others. Can you upload an example project where you're seeing issues (use the "re-open" button at the top of this form) ? Thanks!

** Closed by RyanCavanaugh 08/12/2013 12:49PM

Some additional info I forget to mention : I have also upgraded Web Essentials to the latest version on both machines... so normally there can be no interference anymore from Web Essentials since they removed all Typescript support

Typings included in the project : 
angularjs
jquery
restangular
signalr
underscore

There are about 54 ts files ( .d.ts files included)
